column4: Hey, is anyone around that can give me any adice with xserver?
When setting up xserver - I get an error saying that it failed, looking through my logs it seems to me that its not reading my PCI Express card
i used lspci | grep PCI to find if my card was even on the list
(WW) ATI: PCI in slot 1:0:0 could not be detected!
(WW) ATI: PCI in slot 1:0:1 could not be detected!
give it a couple of minutes for the network to settle down
that's ok , go ahead now , what is the issue
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
reboot with the previous kernel see if it works
it will be subject to netsplit as well
reboot did nothing - same error
did you reboot the previous kernel ? or the new one ?
I'm not sure how to reboot to a prev. kernel
you have this problem since the last kernel update ?   when you boot enter the grub menu and select the previous version of the kernel from the list provided,  should be the 3rd item down
there was no option to select my kernel - text pops up immediately and very quickly, then the Ubuntu loading screen comes on, then shell
can you boot recovery mode ?
how do I do that?
boot thelive cd and come back here
xserver didn't work on live cd either - it freaked out and threw words all over the screen
have you ever had ubuntu working onthis computer ?
I'm running an ATI Radeon x850 Platinum Edition
maybe one ofthe others can help you on this,  ati / nvidia cards realy harenT' my thing
thanks for the help :)
